intro: Elcismia linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf elcismia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its linear leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Elcismia linearis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
